greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n occurs n times, as early as possible subject to the constraint that no two successive terms are identical.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: After a(8) = 4 the next term is 5 as 3 has already occurred three times.
program: f x ws = v : f v (us ++ vs) where (us, v:vs) = span (== x) ws
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Dec 05 2004
ext: Corrected and extended by _Ray Chandler_, Dec 08 2004
